Package org.jtrim2.property

Interface MutableProperty<ValueType>

Type Parameters:
ValueType - the type of the value of the property
All Superinterfaces:
PropertySource<ValueType>
All Known Subinterfaces:
MutablePropertyProxy<ValueType>
public interface MutableProperty<ValueType> extends PropertySource<ValueType>
Defines a PropertySource whose value can be changed by the client code by calling the setValue method.

Thread safety

The setValue method does not need to be thread-safe and must not be called concurrently with another setValue call of the same MutableProperty. Methods inherited from PropertySource however, may be called concurrently by multiple threads. They may even be called concurrently with the setValue method.

Recommendation: When using the property for Swing components, it is recommended to only call the setValue from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread because this is consitent with other property usages in Swing.

Synchronization transparency

The setValue method does not need to be synchronization transparent but methods inherited from PropertySource must honor the contract of PropertySource. That is, only methods inherited from PropertySource required to be synchronization transparent.
See Also:

    Methods inherited from interface org.jtrim2.property.PropertySource

    addChangeListener, getValue

  • Method Details

    • setValue

      void setValue(ValueType value)
      Sets the value of this property to the given value, so that subsequent getValue calls will return the currently set value.

      This method will cause the currently registered change listeners to be notified unless the property is set to its current value (not changed). Note however, that implementations are not required to detect that the value is not changed (set to the current value) and may notify the change listeners anyway.

      Implementations might decide to notify the listeners synchronously in this setValue call but it is generally implementation dependent when and from what context the listeners are notified.

      Parameters:
      value - the new value of this property. Implementations may put some constraint on the allowed value of this property.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the implementation does not allow null value for this property and the specified value is null
      IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the implementation does not allow the property to be set for the specified value
